You barely had the time to regret your hasty decision as Barbara magically poofed into the air above you, what must've been over 50 feet tall already and still growing. You cried out in surprise, but went quiet as she crushed you. Truthfully, you expected to die, but you didn't feel like you were in pain? In fact, you didn't feel half bad...that must be Merissa's doing. But what was going on? You just felt really...compressed...

---

Barbara had managed to destroy her favorite coffee table, and she was pretty sure she might've damaged the drywall. But she realized that she'd probably be breaking a bit more than a few of her belongings as she swelled up to titanic proportions. "Does insurance cover this?" she mused, the living room becoming more claustrophobic as time went on. In a short time, she was filling up the living room completely, crouching in order to avoid busting the ceiling at a surprising 16 feet tall. "Am I really going to burst out of the ceiling?" she asked herself, the absurdity of her question flying over her as she seriously contemplated her plan of action. As she continued to grow, her spacious living room became less spacious as she reached a whopping 40 feet tall, lying down on her stomach as her legs stretched into another room. "Maybe I'll knock down a wall and crawl out, but...the rest of the house might fall on me. Damnit, Lucy, you're going to have to pay me-"

"-back for...Woah!" she said, the air around her turning cold as she slammed into the dirt ass-first. "What the hell did...? Did Lucy make a wish?" "Indeed she did!" came a weaker voice from below. Looking down to the ground, she saw the woman claiming to be Lucy's genie standing between her open legs, reminding her of her 'little' nudity problem. "My mistress used a wish to teleport you outside safely, so that way your home wouldn't be completely destroyed." "That's...great." Lucy said, using an arm to hide her naughty bits from the genie; sure, she may be a genie, but she was getting an eyeful.

But the rest of the neighborhood would be soon, so it hardly mattered.

"Okay...where is she now? What stipulation did she pick?" "In her haste to get you outside, she picked one without looking at what it was. You could say that she's right under our very noses right now!" Merissa said with a smirk. Barbara rolled her eyes. "So, what, you shrank her again? That's not a very good idea, considering how huge I am...and I'm getting!" she added, realizing that her body was still sliding across over the ground as she continued expanding. "Oh, no! I didn't shrink her. But you could say she's feeling a bit compressed right now."

Barbara blinked blankly. "...what are you...?" she began and stopped asking, as a possibility dawned on her. Carefully, she managed to get off the ground and stand up...and finally take stock of how big she was. She was already 100 feet tall! Which was mind boggling. But the proof was in front of her, as her 2 story house looked like a child's play thing, and it would look smaller in a minute! But that wasn't why she stood up. She stood up in order to check where her cheeks had landed. And the spot she had occupied now resembled two circular piles of mud. Devoid of any signs of Lucy.

"Phew...so she wasn't under me." "Don't think I'd rule that out so soon!" came a voice from underneath her. Glancing down, she saw a tiny Merissa standing on a singular boob, at such an angle that nobody but a genie would be able to. "She's a bit closer to you than you'd think. And you definitely sat on her." Gears turned in Barbara's head as she thought about what Merissa said, when eventually it clicked. "...you're kidding me. There's no way." Merissa just smiled, prompting Barbara to sigh as she carefully craned her head to get a peak at own behind...

Yeah, she had sat on something alright. A bunch of dirt. But also a... pink disk? Carefully, after scraping away some dirt, she got under it with a fingernail and peeled it off. It felt just like taking off a band-aid. Reluctantly, she brought it up to her face to examine it, and almost felt a little light headed after seeing what it was. This was getting absurd.

---

After what felt like hours, but in reality was 3 minutes at most, you felt large hands pulling you off of...something. You guessed that Barbara had found you? Whatever the case was, you were whisked to the front of her face, and were a bit surprised to see her so large again, though you knew she would get this large. "What's going on, Barbara?" was something you wanted to ask, but you couldn't really talk. This caused you to panic a little bit, and you tried to move, but couldn't. Barbara could tell you were distressed, so she dropped a bombshell on you: "Sorry Lucy, but I might have sat on you just a liiiiiittle bit. You... look like a pancake in a bikini."

"Apologies, Mistress!" calls up Merissa, having changed to the "relaxing in cleavage" position, not that you could tell. "I would've explained the terms of this stipulation in more detail, but you didn't allow me to! The rules of my magic do not allow you to get harmed in any way, shape, or form as a result of what I do; so you were harmlessly flattened by the shapely behind of your neighbor." This made sense, but you were hardly pleased to hear that this was something that could even happen! You felt flat and floppy, and not in control at all!

"Merissa, change me back!" you tried to say, but again, couldn't. "Yelling isn't going to do you any good right now, mistress, but you needn't worry! Your body will return to its original shape in a few hours!" A few hours? You weren't sure you could wait that long. Plus, you were missing Barbara's show! "I'd like to make a wish, Merissa." you again try to say, without saying anything. "Do you wish to make a wish, Mistress?" Merissa asks, even though she shouldn't know what you said. "Madam, if you could bring her down to my level? I'll simply read her lips to decipher her request."

Barbara grumbled something about Merissa finding a different place to sit, but obliged, holding you in front of her at breast level. "My, mistress, if I didn't know any better I'd mistake you for a flag, fluttering in the wind." You didn't find that very funny, so you made your wish, not spending enough time to think about the wording;

Merissa begins, "These coins represent the following stipulation: because you have effectively undone the stipulation you originally chose when you became this vehicle's owner, you are no longer entitled to it."

"Not only that," Merissa says, "but you can never wish for it again, nor any other motor vehicle."

You sigh, knowing that means effectively taking on two stipulations - one when you wish to be able to make the wish, and another when you actually make the wish. Still, there's other ways of getting a car, you think.

If it's a quarter full, you'll be one-fourth of your size. You remember Merissa said you wouldn't end up any smaller than an inch, and also that the tank was currently full, so you wouldn't shrink right away. Barbara wasn't so rough with you (aside from accidentally stepping on you) but could you count on other people to be the same?

Good riddance. Merissa uses her free hand to direct your attention to the first coin, which shows a figure that seems to be swapping souls with another. You think it must be like the one Merissa detailed to you earlier but was too small for you to see.

"And be swapping bodies," you say.

"I should clarify that you won't be able to wish to body swap yourself, as that will automatically be happening," your genie says. "Also, you won't be put into animals."

"Yeah, it'd be hard to wish if I couldn't talk," you say as Merissa directs you to her second coin, which depicts the same size-changing figure from so many times before.

"This coin represents the Price of the Big Deal," she says. "You'll be able to make unlimited wishes, but you'll be reduced to six inches tall, and you can't wish to be any bigger than that, nor make anyone as small as you. Any other way you might think of to try and wish around it will always backfire."

"Finally, there's the third option," Merissa says as she directs you to the third coin, which depicts three figures, with the one in the middle apparently brokering an agreement between the other two figures, one of which is dressed like a genie. "This coin represents the Price of Intermediary. You'll get your wishes, but you'll have to earn them!"

"Earn them?" you say.

"Yes, by doing other people favors," Merissa says. "Wish-type favors."

"Come again?" you ask.

"Well, it seems selfish to have infinite wishes just for yourself, don't you think?" Merissa explains. "Before I'll grant you a wish, you must convince someone else to make a wish. Once I've granted that wish, you'll be entitled to make one wish."

"Why can't I just wish for them?" you say.

"Because they'll have a better idea of what they want than you," the genie says. "How you get them to wish will be up to you, but you must get them to make the wish."

She looks out the window, where you see your balding, slobby neighbor across the street, Mr. Holtz, staring at your home in his yard.

"You're an all-powerful being now so you shouldn't have too much trouble finding a new place to dwell, Merissa. I wouldn't ask you to leave if I didn't think you could handle it. I'd let you stay as long as I could if not for all the weirdness you're bound to attract."

opens her car up and climbs inside.

Ms. Nichols, you say to yourself. Jackie said she was concerned.

As she stands in your doorway wearing form-fitting jogging attire, Ms. Nichols asks you, "Merissa, are you okay?" It surprises you that she addressed you with the name of the genie that you've fused with. The voice of that genie speaks to you in your mind...

"Reality has changed. Your mother didn't have a son; she had a daughter, named Merissa, and we are her."

"I'm fine, Ms. Nichols," you respond, "how did you get in?"

"Your mom must not have locked the door when she left for work. I'm sorry for barging in, but I had this strange feeling that something was going on over here during that solar eclipse that just happened, and I wanted to check in on you."

Solar eclipse? You didn't think we were due for one. You look outside and see the darkness fading away, revealing a bright, sunny morning. It wasn't nighttime like you thought; apparently, you've started the day over. Merissa's voice speaks to you again.

"That 'solar eclipse' was actually an extremely local phenomenon brought about as a result of my power being unbound by my old body."

"Oh, dear," she says, pointing at the floor. "That bottle broke!" You look and see the remains of the bottle that once contained your other half lying where she points.

"Yeah, I was just dusting it when I was distracted by that eclipse and dropped it by mistake," you say. It's half-true. You did drop it while dusting it but you don't remember it breaking.

"Oh, well, I think I can piece it back together and have it looking like mostly-new," she says. "I have some Power-Glue back at my house."

"Oh, you don't have to worry about that, Ms. Nichols," you respond. "I'll just explain to mom and..."

"Nonsense," she says. "I know it's just an old bottle but if I can save you a scolding from your mom, it'll be worth while right?"

You find it hard to fault Ms. Nichols' logic. "Yeah, okay, I'll let you repair it, Ms. Nichols!"

"Great!" she says with a smile. "Let's gather the pieces up."

You run to the kitchen to grab a canvas shopping bag to set the pieces of the vessel in, then help Ms. Nichols gather them up. As you do so, Merissa speaks...

"Three things: Number one: the bottle breaking is symbolic of you being unleashed."

"I figured," you think.

"Number two: the only reason your neighbor thinks it's just an old bottle is because one of the two wishes your mother, who was also technically your master, made, was that it look like an ordinary bottle to everyone else, including your late father, and even you. Of course, now you know it's not."

"Understood," you think as you drape the bag with the bottle pieces around your shoulder. "And what's three?"

"Number three: While this might seem like neighborly concern, she is feeling the effect of your unbound magic. This may be due to attraction that you've felt for her enticing her unknowingly. The longer you stay around her, the more it will escalate."

"Oh dear," you say as you follow Ms. Nichols out the door, noticing there's a little bit more spring in her step than you've seen before. After you lock your door and proceed to her house, Merissa continues...

"I don't know if she'll lust after your magic or your body, or even both. Regardless, I'll be here with you to guide you, or make suggestions, depending on how you want to approach things. Remember first and foremost that you are never trapped by the whims of mundane mortals; you are an immortal force now."

"I'll try to keep that in mind," you think as you enter Ms. Nichols' home and close her door, locking it behind you. You've been in her living room a few times before with your mother years ago after she just moved in and it looks about the same. Some furniture is moved around, there's a new TV, but otherwise, there's nothing that really stands out. You walk past her end table and notice that next to the telephone, there's a note with a law firm's phone number written on it, along with a doodle of a stick-figure with crudely-drawn hair and breasts bringing her foot down on a much smaller stick-figure. You've never asked Ms. Nichols about her ex-husband, but you get the feeling she's not happy at all with him.

"I keep the Power-Glue in my little workshop," she says as she leads you up the stairs. It seems to you like she's making more of an attempt to walk sexy as she takes each step, but you try to keep your old crush for her in check.

She turns at the top of the stairs and continues down the hallway, past the open door of her bedroom that looks like it has a soft bed, to a room at the very end of the hall. She opens it and flicks the light switch inside and invite you in.

The center of the room has a little work table inside, covered in various arts-and-crafts supplies. The walls are covered in shelves, adorned with dolls of various kinds on one side and model cars, many of which are either of sports cars, muscle cars, exotic vehicles on the other.

"Welcome to my hobby room, Merissa," Ms. Nichols announces.

"I've never seen your collections before," you say. "I'm impressed with them, Ms. Nichols!"

"Call me Barbara," she says. "We're both adults here, Merissa." Though she said this in a casual manner, it doesn't stop you from gulping a little as you worry about whatever effect you might be having on her.

"Okay, 'Barbara,'" you say, as you set your bag of bottle parts on her work table. "How did you get so many of both?"

"Well, I've been collecting dolls and designing them since I was a little girl," she recalls as she starts pulling the pieces out. "Then, when I was a teenager, I started taking an interest in cars. I've always wanted to own a garage full of cars, but life and my paychecks conspired against me! But at least this way, I can have a little collection. Anyway, let's get started putting this bottle back together."

You pull another chair up to her desk and watch as she begins to piece the bottle parts back together again. There are two main halves, along with a few pieces between them. She affixes the pieces the smaller pieces to the larger ones with her glue and sets them down on the table, then looks at you. "We need to let those pieces sit for a while and dry before sticking them back together," she says. "Frankly, though, I'm starting to think this wasn't the best idea. I think the damage is going to be more visible than I thought."

"That's okay... Barbara," you say. "Maybe it'll turn out nice when it's finished. Thanks for trying to keep me out of trouble, though."

"No problem at all, Merissa," she laughs. "You know, if I didn't know any better, I'd say that bottle contained a genie."

"You don't say?" Merissa voice snaps in your head.

"Really?" you say, with a nervous laugh.

"Yeah, I know, it's silly," Barbara laughs. "Merissa, if you had a genie, what would you wish for?"

"Ummm," you pause, "unlimited wishes?"

"I don't know," Barbara remarks, "you'd probably have to pay some kind of price for that."

"You have no idea, sister."
